alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 12:41AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell and Claiborne. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen since about 1130 PM EDT. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. The central part of Claiborne County had heavy rainfall earlier this evening so this additional rainfall could cause additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Tazewell, Tazewell, Harrogate, Jellico, Clairfield, Arthur, Springdale, Cumberland Gap, White Oak, Powell River Preserve and Indian Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
